metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1010174 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
CImg The CImg Library v.2.3.3 and earlier is affected by: command injection. The impact is: RCE. The component is: load_network() function. The attack vector is: Loading an image from a user-controllable url can lead to command injection, because no string sanitization is done on the url. The fixed version is: v.2.3.4.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1010174` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gimp-gmic - 2.9.4-4build3
gmic - 2.9.4-4build3
gmic-zart - 2.9.4-4build3
krita-gmic - 2.9.4-4build3
libgmic1 - 2.9.4-4build3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gmic package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.4-4build3').
